doc.title: Sal
doc.plot: Sal Aunese, University Of Colorado quarterback, falls ill to stomach cancer in 1989 and dies. He impregnates head coach Bill McCartney's daughter, Kristyn, and their son, T.C. is born shortly before Sal's death in the fall of 1989. The University Of Colorado Buffalo Football Team dedicate the remainder of the 1989-1990 Football Season to Sal's honor, and face Notre Dame for the National Championship in the Orange Bowl. Colorado loses, but the "Buffs" re-dedicate the following season to Sal's spirit, and face off again vs. Notre Dame for the NCAA National Championship again. This time the Buffs win it all and salute their Golden Helmets to the sky in honor of Sal on January 01, 1991 in Miami, Florida in front of a stunned nation.
